frameDefinitions: An Employer employs an Employee whose Position entails that the Employee perform certain Tasks in exchange for Compensation.
A Cognizer computes a Result on the basis of input Numbers by addition.   '
A Speaker states or makes known a future Eventuality on the basis of some Evidence.
A Cognizer carries out an approximate calculation or considers some Evidence so as to arrive at an approximate Value for some Feature of an Item.
An Entity possesses a Value for a certain Attribute which is extreme when compared to the values either of other entities or to values of the same Entity at other points of time.
The absolute Value of a quantifiable Attribute  of an item is determined by adding up the values for the Attribute of the individuals or parts that make up the item.
frameExamples: I <t>employed</t> him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
The Weather Centre <t>predicted</t> that it would be warmer but wet for the weekend.
Until 1971, dolphin mortality could be <t>estimated</t> only from analyses of vessels ' logbooks -- and the figures are probably underestimates. CNI
Defence is provided in West Germany by armed forces whose number <t>totals</t> close to half a million men and women
listRoleDefinitions: The role <fen>Employee</fen> denotes the person who is obligated to perform some <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> is the person (or institution) that gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Field</fen> identifies the field in which the <fen>Employee</fen> is employed.
The role <fen>Position</fen> indicates a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Task</fen> indicates the action/duty that the <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to do for the <fen>Employer</fen>.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies the time at whcih the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Place</fen> identifies the location where the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The person doing the calculation.
The <fen>Numbers</fen> that are used in the calculation.
The outcome of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s calculcations.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> operates on the <fen>Numbers</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> performs their calculation
The <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a prediction.

This role marks expressions that indicate an event or state that is predicted to occur or hold at a future time. A single <fen>Eventuality</fen> may be expressed discontinuously in a raising construction. This role is also used for expressions that denote entities with variable attributes about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes predictions.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the prediction.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the prediction pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by <m>about</m>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the prediction is made.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the prediction.
The individual who considers evidence or performs calculations to arrive at an approximation.
The feature is a scalar property of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The position or area  on the <fen>Feature</fen> scale that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> concludes the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The entity that possesses the <fen>Feature</fen> whose <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Cognizer</fen> seeks to approximate.
A proposition expressing the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s approximation of a <fen>Feature</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
An open proposition for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> seeks to approximate the <fen>Value</fen> of a variable.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms the estimate of the <fen>Feature</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms their estimate.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose <fen>Value</fen> of a particular gradable <fen>Attribute</fen> is extreme.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The value of an attribute.
The scalar property of a concrete or abstract entity.
A set of numbers that add up to the <fen>Value</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> was employed by an international corporation.
<fex>I</fex> employed him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
He was employed<fex>in finance</fex> fourteen years ago.
I'm not employed <fex>as your waitress</fex>!
I am employed <fex>to collect the trash</fex>.
Charles has been an employee of Microsoft <fex>since 1998</fex>!
Actually, he employed me <fex> at the downtown office </fex>.
<fex>The institute</fex> forecast an increase in leisure spending of 15 per cent.
Predicting <fex>the weather</fex> is risky business.
The events that would occur over the next several years had been predicted <fex>in the Bible</fex>.
John predicted <fex>last year</fex> that he would be finished by October.
Greenman predicted <fex>at a small dinner party</fex> that the market would rise again.
<fex>The government</fex> estimated the cost of meeting EC water standards at £3-4 billion.

In one march from 42 Street down to Washington Square Park, the crowds were
estimated <fex>in size</fex> from 125000 (NYPD estimate) to over 200000 (march organizers).
Sotheby 's have estimated its value <fex>at $10m-$14m</fex>.
I estimated <fex>the house</fex> at about 60-65% full.
At the time they estimated <fex>there to be as many as four million to the acre</fex>.
Then Sandia estimated <fex>how many people would die and be injured within the first year due to their radiation exposure</fex>.
The US Forest Service estimated <fex>last year</fex> that 45 million piñons have died so far in north-central New Mexico.
<fex>At the London School of Economics</fex> they estimated that China would have to spend 2% of gross. domestic product on higher. education for 15 years
<fex>JetBlue's</fex> high of $55.15 was reached on May 6
East Harlem reached its historic <fex>population</fex> high of 210000 in 1950.
The state of Michigan reported a new unemployment high <fex>of 7%</fex>.
The final tally for 1990 was <fex>199,000</fex> .
During the first three years of drug squad work, <fex>arrests</fex> totaled some sixty-four persons.
Look, you turn those into numbers, and then <fex>592 and 74</fex> total 666, right?
